intro: Gilia graciosa, commonly known as the showy gilia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the evening primrose family (Onagraceae) and typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. The plant produces striking, showy flowers that range in color from pink to purple, often with a white or yellow center. It blooms from spring to early summer, and its flowers are pollinated primarily by bees and other insects. The plant is also known for its ability to thrive in arid conditions, making it a hardy and adaptive species.
